DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies the intent of the images that are contained within this Series (Part 3; Ref C.8.11.1.1.1 detailed explanation).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Identifies the intent of the images that are contained within this Series.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/20/11 - Released as part of cleanup review.  7/7/07-CDE updated to support DICOM CDE IE DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.; 2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A type which identifies the intent of the images that are contained within this Series (Part 3; Ref C.8.11.1.1.1 detailed explanation).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Images that have been corrected to account for characteristics of the detector but which are intended to be further processed before being displayed, shall have an Enumerated Value of FOR PROCESSING.

PermissibleValues.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A Series of Images intended for viewing by an observer, after application of any grayscale transformations specified in the image object such as VOI LUT, shall have an Enumerated Value of FOR PRESENTATION.

PermissibleValues.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/20/11 - Released as part of cleanup review.  7/7/07  DEC updated to support DICOM task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.; 2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 7/20/11 - Released as part of cleanup review.  7/7/07-CDE updated to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.;  3/22/07 - Assigned CDEs to DICOM-Review Set 1 CSI
